Class ChessAPI

java.lang.Object
ChessAPI
public class ChessAPI
extends java.lang.Object

The helper class that handles all interaction with the Chess API.

All API endpoints specified in comments assume a prefix of: http://chess-api-chess.herokuapp.com/api/v1/chess One/Two player must be specified. This is used to determine which endpoint to call.

All of these functions should probably throw an exception for error-handling and debugging purposes. Fell free to make an exception accordingly

  • Constructor Details

    • ChessAPI

      public ChessAPI()
      Creates a new ChessAPI object. This needs to call the Heroku Chess API's Create New Game endpoint /one and set the gameID accordingly.

  • Method Details

    • getPossibleMoves

      public java.util.List<Move> getPossibleMoves​(Piece piece)
      Use the Chess API to figure out the possible moves for a given Piece. Should use /one/moves
      Parameters:
      piece - the piece to check movements of
      Returns:
      An (Array)List of the possible moves

    • movePlayer

      public void movePlayer​(Move move)
      Tell the Chess API about a move the player made. Endpoint is /one/move/player
      Parameters:
      move - The move to execute

    • checkGameOver

      public boolean checkGameOver()
      Check's if the game is over. Endpoint is /one/check This should be run after every single move. This isn't actually used to the the Chess API being broken. The game will never have the chance to get to this point.
      Returns:
      True if the game IS over, false if it isn't.

    • moveAI

      public Move moveAI​(Board board)
      In the case of a single-player game, lets the AI take it's turn. Endpoint is /one/move/ai
      Parameters:
      board - The current game's Board. Objects are pass-by-ref, so just update that object, no need to return anything.

    • getGameID

      public java.lang.String getGameID()
      Getter
      Returns:
      the gameID
